title: Electric force - find spheres charge and Coulomb k

content.question: Show all your work for each part of the the question. The parts within the question may not have equal weight.Sphere <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and Sphere <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> are identical conducting spheres, each with a positive net charge. Sphere <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> is attached to an insulating stand and Sphere <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> is suspended from an ideal nonconducting string. The spheres are briefly brought into contact and then separated, after which they have the same net charge.(a) Without removing the spheres from their attachments, design an experimental procedure students could use to collect data that would allow them to make a linear graph to determine the charge on each sphere. Provide enough detail so that the experiment could be replicated, including any steps necessary to reduce experimental uncertainty.
